qas.question: Greece's secondary education has how many school types?
What is one type of Greece's secondary education?
What type of institute does secondary education also include?
What type of education do vocational institutes provide?

context: Greece's post-compulsory secondary education consists of <a0_0>two<a0_0/> school types: <a1_0>unified upper secondary schools<a1_0/> (Γενικό Λύκειο, Genikό Lykeiό) and technical–vocational educational schools (Τεχνικά και Επαγγελματικά Εκπαιδευτήρια, "TEE"). Post-compulsory secondary education also includes <a2_0>vocational training<a2_0/> institutes (Ινστιτούτα Επαγγελματικής Κατάρτισης, "IEK") which provide a <a3_0>formal but unclassified<a3_0/> level of education. As they can accept both Gymnasio (lower secondary school) and Lykeio (upper secondary school) graduates, these institutes are not classified as offering a particular level of education.
